DataElement.preferredName: EQ-5D-3L Questionnaire v1.0 1 Walking Mobility Today Status 3 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Persons' stated observation of their health state today as related to mobility (walking about), using a 3 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: European Quality of Life Five Dimension Three Level Questionnaire Walking Mobility Today Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 3 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient._A question about an individual's current walking mobility._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized rating scale which is used as a measure of health outcome. This instrument is a descriptive system consisting of 5 dimensions: mobility, self-care, usual activity, pain/discomfort, and anxiety/depression. Each dimension has 3 levels ranging from no problem to extreme problem or incapable, which are assessed by the patient.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A three point ordered reference standard that describes current health state related to walking mobility using the EQ-5D-3L questionnaire.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is confined to bed.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is confined to bed.

PermissibleValues.value: I have no problems in walking about

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had no problems walking.

PermissibleValues.value: I have some problems in walking about

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual has or had some problems walking.

ClassificationSchemes.longName: Quality of Life Measures (Patient Reported Outcomes - Health Related Quality of Life)

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. Where an investigator wants to use single Patient Reported Outcome items that are integrated into a study, DCP review is required prior to inclusion of the item on a case report form.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Medidata ePRO CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This CDE has been validated for use with the Medidata Rave ePRO module.
